results.title: The Monster and you
results.creator_credit: Zagreb Film, World Health Organisation, Tadeusz Makarczynski and Boris Kolar
results.brief_description: Uses animation in presenting a discussion on tuberculosis, pointing out factors contributing to its increase. Urges the use of X-rays and regular medical examinations for early detection and outlines methods of treatment and prevention of tuberculosis.

results.title: The Monsoon frog (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
A young boy, learning to hunt is told never to harm the green frog. In answer to his question why, he is told the story of a young boy of the Dreamtime who had no respect for nature. When the monsoon did not come one year he threatened to kill the green frog, bringer of the monsoon, if she did not send the rain. In revenge she sent her children, thunder and lightning to kill him, but he meets with Tiddalik the giant frog, which causes further complications … Narrated by Belzah Lowah.

results.title: The Monkey who would be king
results.brief_description: Real animals fill the roles in this adaptation of a fable for children. When the Lion abdicates, all the animals gather to see whom he chooses as successor. The Monkey snatches the crown, and is able to establish himself as ruler. Soon, though, he learns the cost of kingship.

results.title: The Monkey and the crab
results.brief_description: This film is a Japanese variation of the work fable of the grasshopper-ant type. Animated puppets are used to portray the industrious farmer crab bluffed out of his rice crop by a lazy monkey. However, crab and his friends are able to gain their revenge. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Monkey's paw
results.creator_credit: Martha Moran and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Be careful what you wish for in this classic horror tale about a magical monkey’s paw and its power of granting three wishes to whoever possesses it. Adapted from the story by W.W. Jacobs. Cast includes Evelyn Goffman, Herb Graham, Robb W. King, Ted Gold, Byron Clarke.

results.title: The Monkey's mask
results.creator_credit: Arenafilm, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Robert Connolly, John Maynard and Samantha Lang
results.brief_description: Dorothy Porter’s prose novel, “The Monkey’s Mask” was a tantalizing blend of the noir aesthetic, nocturnal sexual desire and the back stabbing Sydney literary scene. Given that, director Samantha Lang’s task to translate it into a coherent cinematic whole proves a challenging task. Susie Porter stars as Sapphic private detective Jill Fitzpatrick, who is called in to investigate the mysterious disappearance of literature student and grunge poet, Mickey Norris (Abbie Cornish). Jill’s investigation leads her to Mickey’s lecturer, the sensuous Diana (Kelly McGillis), who although married and a potential suspect, Mickey begins a passionate affair with. Lang and her cast have plenty of fun with the unlikely coupling of the gritty film noir genre and the cliquey Sydney poetry scene, mixing the two at times to witty effect. Lang and screenwriter Anne Kennedy also play with the literary form by dividing the film into chapter headings and having the characters recite some of Dorothy Porter’s elegant prose. Cast includes Deborah Mailman, Marton Csokas, William Zappa, Chris Haywood and Annie Jones.

results.title: The Monkees Live Summer Tour
results.creator_credit: David Fishof and Win Media Corp
results.brief_description: Thirty years after the peak of their fame, “The Monkees” reformed for a North American tour. This disc contains a live performance of that tour. Micky Dolenz, Davy Jones, and Peter Tork are the members from the original line-up that perform on this show. Songs included are: “Last train to Clarksville”, “Look out (here comes tomorrow)”, “For Pete’s sake”, “The Girl I knew somewhere”, “Valleri”, “Randy scouse git”, “Mary Mary”, “Goin’ down”, “Can you dig it?”, “Girl”, “Higher and higher”, “A little bit me, a little bit you”, “She hangs out”, “That was then, this is now”, “Daydream believer”, “I’m a believer”, “(I’m not your) Stepping stone”, “Pleasant Valley Sunday”.

results.title: The Money or the gun = The Year of the patronising bastard
results.creator_credit: Mark Fitzgerald, ABC-TV (Australia) and Martin Coombes
results.brief_description: A special episode of “The Money or the gun” which looks at the community’s attitudes to the disabled. Andrew Denton interviews members of the public and of the disabled community in an attempt to promote a less patronising approach to the physically handicapped. Also known as “The International Year of the Patronising Bastard.” This program has won international awards.
